title: Video: Protests in US over deployment of national guard troops
summary: Thousands of protesters marched in Washington DC and Chicago in the US, to denounce deployment of National Guard troops.

title: Hind Rajab film given major prize at Venice film festival
summary: “The Voice of Hind Rajab” won the Silver Lion Grand Jury Prize, one of the highest honours at the Venice Film Festival.

title: Week in Pictures: From Israeli air raids in Gaza to protests in Serbia
summary: A global roundup of some of last week’s events.

title: Israeli forces destroy another Gaza City tower block
summary: Watch the moment Israeli forces bomb al-Soussi Tower, a high-rise residential building in Gaza City.

title: Pride march in Serbia condemns police violence at antigovernment rallies
summary: The LGBTQ event in Belgrade comes the day after police arrested 42 demonstrators in the city of Novi Sad.

title: Irfaan Ali re-elected for second term as oil-rich Guyana’s president
summary: Centre-left 45-year-old politician gets new mandate to manage the South American nation's newfound oil wealth.

title: Sanders, Mamdani rally progressive voters as NYC mayor’s race intensifies
summary: Mamdani discusses how he plans to address income inequality and affordability issues in the largest US city.

title: Japan’s PM Shigeru Ishiba will resign weeks after election debacle: NHK
summary: The ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) no longer has a majority in either house of parliament.

title: Anutin Charnvirakul takes office as Thailand PM after royal endorsement
summary: Businessman and veteran politician vows to perform his duties 'with honesty and righteousness' amid political turmoil.

title: The Hidden Victims of China’s One-Child Policy | True Crime Reports
summary: The mother who spent 32 years looking for her missing son.

title: Russian attacks on Ukraine’s Kyiv kill at least 3, gov’t building struck
summary: Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko says the early Sunday attack sparked fires at several high-rises in the capital.

title: LIVE: Israeli attacks on school, tents and homes kill at least 17 in Gaza
summary: Israel pounds Gaza City as its troops continue a large-scale offensive to seize the biggest urban centre in the Strip.

title: Imavov calls for Chimaev’s title after UFC main event win over Borralho
summary: Nassourdine Imavov beat Caio Borralho in Paris, then issued a title challenge to UFC middleweight champ Khamzat Chimaev.

title: Gaza war film The Voice of Hind Rajab wins 2nd prize at Venice festival
summary: Director Ben Hania pays tribute to slain five-year old Palestinian girl, calls for accountability for Israeli killings.

title: Trump threatens ‘war’ on Chicago as thousands protest federal crackdown
summary: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker denounces Trump as a wanna-be dictator as protesters rally in Chicago and Washington, DC.

title: Israël : nouvelle manifestation pour réclamer la fin du conflit et la libération de tous les otages
summary: Des manifestations ont eu lieu à Tel-Aviv et à Jérusalem, samedi soir, pour demander la libération des otages et la fin de la guerre à Gaza. Alors que l'armée israélienne a ciblé, samedi, une nouvelle tour d'immeuble à Gaza-ville et appelé les habitants de Gaza à évacuer.

title: À Gaza, l’armée israélienne dirige les déplacés vers des zones dangereuses ou déjà occupées
summary: L’armée israélienne incite les habitants de la ville de Gaza à évacuer vers de prétendues "vastes zones vides" du sud de l’enclave. Nombre de ces zones – où de nouvelles tentes sont apparues ces derniers jours – sont pourtant déjà largement occupées ou se situent dans un périmètre jugé dangereux par l’armée. Sur place, nos Observateurs racontent la difficulté à trouver un endroit où s'installer.

title: Israël : la contestation monte, les opérations à Gaza se poursuivent
summary: En Israël, les manifestations se multiplient pour réclamer la libération des otages et dénoncer la stratégie du Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu. Malgré une contestation croissante au sein de l'opinion publique, les opérations militaires à Gaza continuent. Les précisions de Noga Tarnopolsky, correspondante de France 24 à Jérusalem.

title: À Gaza-ville, la peur des habitants après l'annonce de nouvelles frappes
summary: L'armée israélienne a frappé vendredi 6 septembre une tour d'immeuble dans la ville de Gaza, qu'Israël menace d'une offensive militaire majeure. Selon Rami Abou Jammous, journaliste indépendant à Gaza-ville, la peur grandit chez les habitants. "J'habite à 500-600 mètres de la tour touchée et on sait que ça va bientôt être notre tour. On prépare nos valises, mais on ne sait pas où aller. Tous nos souvenirs peuvent disparaître en trois secondes", témoigne-t-il sur notre antenne.

title: De l’aide humanitaire non livrée à Gaza ? Les ONG contestent
summary: Des influenceurs pro-israéliens affirment que l’aide humanitaire s’entasse et pourri au point de passage de Kerem Shalom parce que les ONG et l’ONU ne la livre pas. Une version contestée par les organisations internationales.

title: Gaza : jusqu’où ira Benjamin Netanyahou ?
summary: Jusqu’où ira la guerre à Gaza ? Alors que les trois-quarts du territoire palestinien sont aujourd’hui contrôlés par Israël, Benjamin Netanyahou se dit déterminé à aller "jusqu'au bout". La libération des otages, elle, semble encore plus complexe à imaginer. Alors que les États-Unis n’ont pas renoncé à leur plan de faire de Gaza la "Riviera du Proche-Orient", quel sort sera réservé aux plus de deux millions de Gazaouis aujourd’hui menacés par la famine ?

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne détruit une tour d'immeuble, le Hamas publie une vidéo de deux otages
summary: L'armée israélienne a frappé, vendredi dans la ville de Gaza, une tour d'immeuble, qui s'est écroulée comme un château de cartes. De son côté, le Hamas a diffusé une vidéo montrant deux otages israéliens enlevés le 7 octobre 2023.

title: Liban : l'armée va commencer à désarmer le Hezbollah, annonce le gouvernement
summary: À l'issue d'une réunion du gouvernement, le ministre libanais de l'Information a indiqué vendredi que l'armée libanaise allait commencer à mettre en œuvre le plan de désarmement du Hezbollah. Les détails de ce plan resteront "secrets".

title: L'armée israélienne affirme avoir pris le contrôle de 40 % de la ville de Gaza
summary: Les troupes israéliennes contrôlent désormais 40 % de la ville de Gaza, a indiqué jeudi soir le porte-parole de l'armée israélienne, Effie Defrin, et ce alors que l'État hébreu n'a jamais annoncé publiquement le début de l'offensive pour s'emparer de cette ville

title: De l'aide non distribuée à Gaza ? Les ONG contestent les récits d’influenceurs pro-Israël
summary: De la nourriture non livrée en plein Gaza ? Depuis fin juillet, des influenceurs invités par l'armée israélienne filment le checkpoint de Kerem Shalom dans Gaza qu'ils montrent rempli d'aide humanitaire non livrée, pour soutenir qu'Israël n'est pas responsable de la famine. Des affirmations rejetées par toutes les ONGs interrogées, qui décrivent la difficulté et la dangerosité à livrer de l'aide actuellement, par ailleurs toujours insuffisante.

title: Gaza : une rentrée des classes sous les bombes israéliennes
summary: Au moins 21.000 enfants vivent avec un handicap causé par la guerre à Gaza entre Israël et le Hamas depuis le 7 octobre 2023, soit plus de la moitié de l'ensemble des enfants blessés, a indiqué le Comité des droits des personnes handicapées (CDPH), organe des Nations unies. Au total, quelque 40.500 enfants ont souffert de "blessures provoquées par la guerre" en près de deux ans, a précisé ce comité composé d'experts qui se réunit deux fois par an à Genève.

title: Egypte : un garçon à tout prix ! Le business de la sélection du genre
summary: Partout en Egypte, des cliniques proposant aux couples de choisir le sexe de leur futur enfant ont pignon sur rue. Avoir au moins un garçon est considéré comme indispensable pour de nombreux Égyptiens, dans les villages en particulier. Si cette pratique est strictement interdite partout en Europe, en Egypte un flou juridique subsiste qui permet sa pratique. Les cliniques de FIV profitent de ce vide législatif pour faire leur publicité à destination des Égyptiens. Reportage de Mathilde Delvigne.

title: Israël s'attend à la fuite d'un million d'habitants de Gaza-ville, menacée d'une opération militaire
summary: Alors que la Défense civile de Gaza a fait état mercredi de 62 morts, Israël a affirmé s'attendre à ce qu'un million de Palestiniens fuient Gaza-ville en raison de l'opération militaire prévue par son armée. Dans la soirée à Jérusalem, des manifestants sont redescendus dans la rue à l'appel des familles d'otages.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne réintègre ses réservistes en vue d'une offensive sur la ville de Gaza
summary: Israël intensifie mardi 2 septembre ses préparatifs militaires en réintégrant dans ses rangs des milliers de réservistes en vue d'une offensive annoncée sur la ville de Gaza, après près de deux années de guerre contre le Hamas.

title: L'armée israélienne réintègre ses réservistes en vue d'une offensive sur la ville de Gaza
summary: Alors qu'Israël accélère ses préparatifs en vue d'"opérations de combat étendues" pour prendre la ville de Gaza, le président français Emmanuel Macron a mis en garde mardi l'État hébreu contre toute "offensive" ou "tentative d’annexion" de territoires, affirmant que cela n’arrêterait pas le mouvement de reconnaissance de l’État palestinien.

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : le siège du gouvernement touché à Kiev, après une attaque aérienne massive de l’armée russe
summary: Selon les données préliminaires publiée par l’armée de l’air ukrainienne, dimanche matin, son ennemi a déployé 823 projectiles – 810 drones et 13 missiles. Il s’agit de la plus grande attaque aérienne depuis le début du conflit lancé en février 2022, selon Kiev.

title: En direct, Gaza : l’armée israélienne fait état de deux projectiles tirés depuis Gaza vers Israël
summary: La défense civile palestinienne a affirmé que 56 personnes sont mortes samedi dans le territoire palestinien, dont quatre dans le quartier de Cheikh Radwane, dans la ville de Gaza, et 19 près d’un centre de distribution d’aide dans le nord.

title: A Gaza, l’effroyable décompte des morts n’inclut pas les dizaines de milliers de victimes indirectes de l’offensive israélienne
summary: Les décès par défaut d’évacuation et par manque de soins ne sont pas pris en compte dans le bilan des victimes, pas plus que les morts du fait des épidémies, de la faim, de la soif qui accablent la population, écrit l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique.

title: Saint Carlo Acutis, « geek de Dieu » et premier millénial canonisé par l’Eglise
summary: Né en 1991 et décédé d’une leucémie à l’âge de 15 ans, Carlo Acutis est canonisé ce dimanche 7 septembre par Léon XIV. Mais c’est le pape François qui avait pris la décision d’élever au rang de saint ce millénial ayant voué ses talents à faire d’Internet un espace d’évangélisation. Une façon pour l’Eglise de tendre la main à la jeunesse.

title: A l’occasion des 250 ans de la naissance de Jane Austen, voyage au pays des groupies de la romancière anglaise
summary: On les appelle les « janéites ». En Angleterre, ces inconditionnels de l’autrice de « Raison et sentiments » et d’« Orgueil et préjugés » se rassemblent, en costume d’époque, pour des repas, des bals ou des conférences autour de leur idole. Nombre d’entre eux se rendront, à partir du 12 septembre, à Bath, au Festival Jane Austen, qui célèbre cette année les 250 ans de la naissance de l’écrivaine.

title: Comment la colonisation de la Cisjordanie par Israël entrave la perspective d’un Etat palestinien ? Comprendre en trois minutes
summary: Pendant que plusieurs pays ont décidé de reconnaître l’Etat palestinien, le gouvernement israélien accélère la colonisation en Cisjordanie, occupée depuis 1967.

title: Nadav Lapid, voix discordante du cinéma israélien
summary: Applaudi dans les festivals internationaux, le cinéma de Nadav Lapid dérange dans son pays. Son dernier film, le grinçant « Oui », en salle le 17 septembre, raconte l’après-7-Octobre et fustige une société gangrenée par un esprit de vengeance et par le nationalisme.

title: Vladimir Poutine, l’éternelle diplomatie du flou
summary: Entre faux-semblants diplomatiques en Alaska et vraies offensives militaires en Ukraine, le Kremlin entretient l’ambiguïté et renforce l’inquiétude des Européens.

title: Au Mexique, les premiers pas d’homme libre de l’ex-compagnon de Florence Cassez
summary: Accusé à tort d’être le cerveau d’un gang de kidnappeurs, Israel Vallarta a recouvré la liberté, le 1ᵉʳ août, après plus de dix-neuf ans de réclusion. Blanchi, ce personnage oublié de l’affaire Cassez est déterminé à démonter la machination qui continue d’accabler sa famille.

title: L’« influenceur de Dieu » Carlo Acutis, premier millénial canonisé par l’Église
summary: L’adolescent italien, mort en 2006 à l’âge de 15 ans, est canonisé à Rome, ce dimanche 7 septembre. Sa mère veille avec intransigeance sur le culte, de plus en plus massif, dont il fait l’objet.

title: Palestine Cola, un soda pro-Gaza et anti-Coca
summary: Lancé par trois Suédois d’origine palestinienne, le Palestine Cola ambitionne de concurrencer Coca-Cola, critiqué pour ses activités dans les territoires occupés par Israël. Les bénéfices ont vocation à être reversés à des organisations caritatives œuvrant dans la bande de Gaza.

title: Argentine : mort de Rosa Roisinblit, emblématique Grand-Mère de la place de Mai, à l’âge de 106 ans
summary: Elle avait cofondé cette association qui se battait pour faire la lumière sur les « disparus » durant les années de dictature, parmi lesquels sa fille enceinte et son gendre. Rosa Roisinblit était parvenue en 2000 à retrouver son petit-fils, né pendant la captivité de sa fille, et avait fait traduire des militaires devant les tribunaux.

title: Festival Visa pour l’image : le Visa d’or news récompense l’Irlandais Ivor Prickett pour son travail sur la guerre au Soudan
summary: Le photographe a suivi pour le « New York Times » la bataille de Khartoum, qui a opposé l’armée soudanaise aux paramilitaires des Forces de soutien rapide entre 2023 et 2025.

title: Accident du funiculaire à Lisbonne : le câble qui reliait les deux cabines s’est trouvé déconnecté juste avant le déraillement, selon les enquêteurs
summary: Une « inspection visuelle » réalisée le matin de l’accident n’avait « détecté aucune anomalie », a précisé le Bureau d’enquête sur les accidents aériens et ferroviaires. Seize personnes sont mortes dans l’accident qui s’est produit mercredi.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : « M. Poutine est la cause de cette guerre, il est la raison des morts », affirme le premier ministre canadien. Retrouvez les informations du 30 août au 6 septembre
summary: Volodymyr Zelensky a déclaré samedi qu’il refusait de rencontrer le président russe à Moscou.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • The London Metropolitan Police used batons to disperse peaceful protestors and arrested dozens of demonstrators calling on the UK government to reverse its decision to designate Palestine Action as a terrorist group. 

  • "The Voice of Hind Rajab" won the Silver Lion grand jury prize at the Venice Film Festival.  

  • Save the Children says that on average at least one Palestinian child has been killed every hour in Gaza during nearly 23 months of war.

  • At least 67 people have been killed by Israel since the early hours of this morning, according to Al Jazeera, citing sources at local hospitals.

  • One of defence company Elbit Systems' plants in the UK city of Bristol has reportedly been closed in the wake of a Palestine Action campaign, according to The Guardian.

  • Six Palestinians, including a child, died in the past 24 hours from starvation and malnutrition in the Gaza Strip, Wafa news agency reported, citing medical sources.

  • The United States has placed three leading Palestinian rights organisations – Al-Haq, the Palestinian Centre for Human Rights (PCHR), and Al Mezan – on its sanctions list. 

  • The Israeli military has destroyed more than seventy percent of the buildings in Gaza City, according to Al Jazeera, citing local reports.

title: Israeli protesters call on Trump to end Gaza war
summary:
Israeli protesters call on Trump to end Gaza war

Thousands of Israelis rallied in Tel Aviv on Saturday night, issuing direct appeals to US President Donald Trump to force an end to the war on Gaza and secure the release of the captives.

Protesters packed a public square outside the military headquarters, waving Israeli flags and holding placards with images of the captives. Some carried signs, including one that read: 'Trump’s legacy crumbles as the Gaza war persists'.

"We think that Trump is the only man in the world who has authority over Bibi, that can force Bibi to do this," said Tel Aviv resident Boaz, 40, referring to the Israeli prime minister.

Orna Neutra, the mother of an Israeli soldier who was killed on 7 October, 2023, and whose body is being held in Gaza, accused the government of abandoning its citizens.

“We truly hope that the United States will push both sides to finally reach a comprehensive deal that will bring them home,” she told the rally. Her son, Omer, is also American.

title: Report: Israeli army destroys more than seventy percent of Gaza City buildings
summary:
Report: Israeli army destroys more than seventy percent of Gaza City buildings

The Israeli military has destroyed more than seventy percent of the buildings in Gaza City, according to Al Jazeera, citing local reports.

Meanwhile, Haaretz is reporting that the Israeli military claimed that the Soussi Tower in Gaza City was used by Hamas and acknowledged targeting it today. Hamas denies the Israeli claims.

title: Gaza aid flotilla from Tunisia delayed
summary:
Gaza aid flotilla from Tunisia delayed

The departure from Tunisia of pro-Palestinian activists seeking to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza with aid boats has been postponed, organisers said on Saturday.

It was planned for Sunday, but organisers said they rescheduled the boats' departure from Tunis to Wednesday, 10 September, due to "technical and logistical reasons beyond management's control".

The Maghreb Sumud Flotilla, which aimed to join boats of the Global Sumud Flotilla that have already left from Spain and Italy, had already been delayed by bad weather.

Crowds in Tunis gather with unstoppable spirit to join the #GlobalSumudFlotilla on its journey to break the siege on Gaza

📷 alhelou.y (IG) pic.twitter.com/2TWIUpezbA

— Global Sumud Flotilla (@GlobalSumudFlot) September 6, 2025

title: Gaza death toll rises
summary:
Gaza death toll rises

At least 67 people have been killed by Israel since the early hours of this morning, according to Al Jazeera, citing sources at local hospitals.

The majority of these people, 45, were killed in Gaza City, as the Israeli army continues its campaign to seize the city and forcefully displace all its residents south.

title: 'The Voice of Hind Rajab' wins second prize at Venice Film Festival
summary:
'The Voice of Hind Rajab' wins second prize at Venice Film Festival

"The Voice of Hind Rajab", a gut-wrenching Gaza film that left audiences sobbing at its premiere, won the Silver Lion grand jury prize at the Venice Film Festival on Saturday.  

The movie, from French-Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Hania, is about the real-life killing of five-year-old Palestinian girl Hind Rajab by Israeli forces while her family was trying to flee Gaza. 

An investigation found that the car in which Rajab was killed had been hit with 335 bullets.

She was found dead on 10 February 2024 in northern Gaza, after nearly two weeks of being trapped inside a car with her family while being surrounded by Israeli military forces and being subject to Israeli fire.

title: Egypt says describing displacement of Palestinians as voluntary is 'nonsense'
summary:
Egypt says describing displacement of Palestinians as voluntary is 'nonsense'

Egyptian Foreign Minister Badr Abdelatty, whose country is a key mediator in efforts to end Israel's war on Gaza, said on Saturday that describing the displacement of Palestinians as voluntary was "nonsense".

Israel earlier called on Gaza City residents to leave for the south, as its forces advance deeper into the enclave’s largest urban area.

"If there is a manmade famine (in Gaza), it is to push residents out of their land. It is nonsense to say that this is voluntary displacement," Abdelatty said in a joint press conference with the commissioner-general of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees, Philippe Lazzarini.

title: Report: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man who threw water bottle on road
summary:
Report: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man who threw water bottle on road

Israeli soldiers killed a 57-year-old Palestinian man as he threw a water bottle on the road at the Al-Muraba’ah checkpoint, south of Nablus in the occupied West Bank, according to activists.

Reporting the killing, the Israeli activist group Mistaclim identified the victim as Ahmed Abd al-Fatah Shehadeh.

Al-Muraba’ah checkpoint, south of Nablus. A resident of the village Urif, Ahmed Abd al-Fatah Shehadeh, 57, threw a water bottle on the road and was shot dead by soldiers.

Soldiers killed a 57-year-old Palestinian who threw a water bottle on the ground.
Soldiers killed a… pic.twitter.com/LnfJkj2wUe

— מסתכלים לכיבוש בעיניים (@Mistaclim) September 6, 2025

title: Unrwa chief says Gaza 'manmade famine' can be reversed
summary:
Unrwa chief says Gaza 'manmade famine' can be reversed

Unrwa Commissioner-General Philippe Lazzarini said total impunity and lack of empathy have made life for Palestinians in Gaza "an inferno."

In a post on X, Lazzarini said the latest plague is a "manmade famine" and "it can be reversed."

"All it takes to change course is political will, open the gates & let us work," he said, adding that Unrwa alone has enough food and assistance currently stuck in Egypt and Jordan to cover the critical needs of the entire population for three months.

Total impunity & lack of empathy have made life for Gazans an inferno.

The latest plague is a manmade #famine. It can be reversed : all it takes to change course is political will, open the gates & let us work.

In Cairo today, I called again for an immediate #ceasefire to… pic.twitter.com/tlLrBaUCiT

— Philippe Lazzarini (@UNLazzarini) September 6, 2025

title: Israel kills 60 Palestinians in last 24 hours
summary:
Israel kills 60 Palestinians in last 24 hours

At least 58 people, including  16 aid seekers, have been killed by Israeli forces on Saturday, according to Al Jazeera, citing hospital sources in the Strip.

The sources said 37 people were killed in Gaza City and the northern Gaza Strip,

Hamad Hospital said 70 aid seekers were wounded by Israeli army fire in the northern Gaza Strip.

title: Arrests made at demonstration against Palestine Action proscription in London
summary:
Arrests made at demonstration against Palestine Action proscription in London

Police in London have arrested protesters calling for Palestine Action to have its proscription as a terrorist group repealed.

Hundreds had gathered in Westminster's Parliament Square holding placards reading "I support Palestine Action" and opposing Israel's ongoing genocide in Gaza.

“Officers have begun making arrests for expressing support for proscribed terror organisation Palestine Action at the protest organised by Defend Our Juries," the Metropolitan Police said in a statement.

Defend Our Juries (DOJ), which has staged regular protests since the government moved to proscribe Palestine Action in July, told protesters who signed up for Saturday’s demonstration to withhold their details from officers to force mass processing at police stations.

The group had scheduled a press conference on Tuesday to announce that an estimated 1,500 people were going to risk arrest under the Terrorism Act for holding signs reading, “I oppose genocide. I support Palestine Action.”

Read more: Arrests made at demonstration against Palestine Action proscription in London

title: Police use batons as dozens arrested at Palestine Action protest
summary:
Police use batons as dozens arrested at Palestine Action protest

Submitted by Areeb Ullah on Sat, 09/06/2025 - 16:59
Elderly demonstrators and families of Holocaust survivors were among those detained in Parliament Square
An elderly protester is taken away by police officers at a "Lift The Ban" demonstration in support of the proscribed group Palestine Action, calling for the recently imposed ban to be lifted, in Parliament Square, central London, on September 6, 2025.
Off

The London Metropolitan Police used batons to disperse peaceful protestors and arrested dozens of demonstrators calling on the UK government to reverse its decision to designate Palestine Action as a terrorist group. 

Hundreds had gathered in Westminster's Parliament Square on Saturday, holding cardboard placards reading "I support Palestine Action" and flags in support of Palestine. 

Officers surrounded protestors and carried them one by one to waiting vans, with an officer holding each limb, as crowds chanted "shame on you." 

Some of those facing arrest stayed silent, while others chanted "free Palestine" and urged officers not to follow orders and let them go.

Middle East Eye also saw officers reading out a pre-prepared statement to protestors they were arresting, stating that they were detaining them on "suspicion that you are a member or supporter of the proscribed group Palestine Action."

One protestor was seen with blood streaming down his face after they were arrested at the rally. While another protestor could be heard screaming that the police had hurt his back during their arrest. 

Before the protest, organisers were seen handing out pens, pieces of cardboard and legal advice to participants, before they sat down at 1PM in parliament square. 

Officers from City of London Police, Wales Police and Suffolk Police could be seen assisting the Metropolitan Police's operation on Saturday. 

Among the group of people detained by the police included scores of elderly protestors and families of Holocaust survivors who sat silently on the green in Parliament Square. 

Steve Masters, a British army veteran, was arrested by Metropolitan Police for holding a paper sign in support of Palestine Action and was carried away by officers after being removed from his wheelchair.

Before his arrest, he told Middle East Eye that he joined the protests after witnessing the "depressing scenes unfolding in Gaza."

"I served in the Royal Air Force for 19 years. I feel its important to be here because, whether or not you agree with the tactics of Palestine Action and others - the reality is that our government is complicit in genocide at the highest level," Masters told Middle East Eye. 

"Coming here to oppose the proscription is the least I can do, compared to the sacrifices being made by the people of Gaza and by those taking direct action with Palestine Action."

The London Metropolitan Police on X said the police at 5PM had arrested 150 people so far, adding that officers had been subjected to an “exceptional level of abuse including punches, kicks, spitting and objects being thrown, in addition to verbal abuse”.

“Any assaults against officers will not be tolerated and arrests have already been made,” they added in a post on X. “We will identify all those responsible and prosecute to the full extent of the law.”

Defend Our Juries (DOJ), which has staged regular protests since the government moved to proscribe Palestine Action in July, told protesters who signed up for Saturday’s demonstration to withhold their details from officers to force mass processing at police stations.

The group had scheduled a press conference on Tuesday to announce that an estimated 1,500 people were going to risk arrest under the Terrorism Act for holding signs reading, “I oppose genocide. I support Palestine Action.”

But the conference was postponed after seven of its key speakers, including former government lawyer Tim Crosland, were arrested under section 12 of the Terrorism Act 2000. DOJ said arrestees had been held over the custody time limit of 24 hours and had their homes raided.

On Thursday, the Home Office won a legal decision to challenge the decision to grant a judicial review of Palestine Action's proscription under terror legislation that was due to be held in November. 

Israel's genocide in Gaza
Katherine Hearst
Ava Warriner
News

title: Six Palestinians die of starvation in Gaza in 24 hours
summary:
Six Palestinians die of starvation in Gaza in 24 hours

Six Palestinians, including a child, died in the past 24 hours from starvation and malnutrition in the Gaza Strip, Wafa news agency reported, citing medical sources.

The deaths bring the total number of starvation-related fatalities in the enclave to 382, including 135 children, the agency said.

title: Israeli forces open fire in West Bank town of Beit Fajjar
summary:
Israeli forces open fire in West Bank town of Beit Fajjar

Sources told Al Jazeera Arabic Israeli forces opened fire during a raid on the town of Beit Fajjar, south of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank.

The escalation comes as the war on Gaza, ongoing since October 2023, has killed more than 64,000 Palestinians and injured over 161,000, most of them women and children.

title: One child killed every hour in Gaza war: Save the Children
summary:
One child killed every hour in Gaza war: Save the Children

Save the Children says that on average at least one Palestinian child has been killed every hour in Gaza during nearly 23 months of war.

Figures from Gaza authorities show more than 20,000 children – about two percent of the territory’s child population – have been killed since October 2023. Among them are at least 1,009 babies under the age of one, with nearly half born and killed during the war.

“This is a shameful statistic – a horrific new low in a war characterised by a constant stream of them,” said Ahmad Alhendawi, Save the Children’s regional director for the Middle East, North Africa and Eastern Europe.

“Worst of all, we saw this coming. Systematic attacks on children’s homes, playgrounds, schools and hospitals, starvation by design – the world is doing nothing to stop it.”

title: Head of Grozny state TV accuses Chechen emigrants of links to LGBTQ+ and Wahhabist groups
summary: According to Chingiz Akhmadov, Chechens who left the republic simultaneously support radical Islam and are ‘gays’.

title: Batumi Police Chief Dgebuadze transferred one month after Amaghlobeli’s sentencing
summary: Batumi Police Chief Irakli Dgebuadze was accused of inhumane treatment by imprisoned journalist Mzia Amaghlobeli and others.

title: Russia expects bilateral trade with Armenia to halve in 2025
summary: Economists suggest it is because of the drop in re-exports of Russian gold.

title: Several Armenian prisoners in Azerbaijan ‘attempt suicide’
summary: Azerbaijan has officially acknowledged it has 23 Armenian prisoners in its custody.

title: Azerbaijan claims Russia helped India block SCO membership bid
summary: Diplomatic sources told the Azerbaijani pro-government media outlet APA that ‘Russia’s actions should be seen as a sign of disrespect toward China’.

title: Putin awards Chechen Prime Minister Daudov rank of lieutenant general
summary: Chechen Prime Minister Magomed Daudov received his previous military rank of major general in 2024.

title: Georgian Dream propagandist turns on Trump and Vance, claims they are tools of the ‘deep state’
summary: The criticism followed President Mikheil Kavelashvili’s complaints about inattention from Washington in an open letter to President Donald Trump.

title: Kavelashvili pardons two jailed opposition leaders, citing participation in municipal elections
summary: Mamuka Khazaradze and Badri Japaridze were arrested for boycotting a controversial parliamentary commission.

title: Friday, 5 September 2025
summary: Regional * The bailiff services of Abkhazia, Russia, and South Ossetia began a series of joint exercises yesterday, hosted by Abkhazia’s Justice Ministry. The goal of the exercises, which will continue until Sunday, is to ‘strengthen cooperation and develop a unified approach to actions in difficult conditions’, Russian state media outlet Sputnik reported. * Russian Deputy Prime Minister Aleksei Overchuk has said that Russia was ‘cautiously optimistic’ about the initialled peace treaty betwee

title: Russia says insurance claims for those wounded and killed in AZAL plane crash have been paid
summary: The official statement by the Russian Foreign Ministry came in response to ‘false’ media reports about the non-payment of insurance funds.

title: Georgian Dream youth leader filmed spitting on and insulting protesters and journalist
summary: An anti-government protest in Tbilisi was the scene of several tense confrontations between Georgian Dream supporters and pro-EU demonstrators.

title: Installation of Armenia’s monumental Jesus statue begins
summary: The statue will be 33-metres high, excluding its pedestal.

title: Putin says he hopes that the problems between Azerbaijan and Russia can be resolved
summary: Moscow believes that relations with Baku will be restored in the near future.

title: Tears, anger, and resolve: how the Georgian public reacted to the sentencing of protesters
summary: Over the course of two days, from 2-3 September, Tbilisi City Court sentenced 20 people from two to two and half years in jail and one protester to eight and a half years in jail on drug charges — another protester was cleared of drug charges. Since the summer, media has been banned from filming inside the courtrooms, court buildings, and courtyards, but since the ban came to force, the practice has been such that the court bailiff and police have been more relaxed on this ban in the courtyard

title: Brother of Armenia’s new Ambassador to US arrested on drug and weapons charges
summary: Mkrtich Mkrtchyan is the brother of Narek Mkrtchyan, who was recently appointed as the new Armenian Ambassador to the US.
